description: Xfactorials - like factorials but use carryless GF(2)[ X ] polynomial multiplication.
comments: In formula X stands for the multiplication in a ring of GF(2)[ X ] polynomials.
links: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..475
formula: a(0) = 1, a(n) = n X a(n-1) (see the Maple function Xfactorial given below).
maple: Xfactorial := proc(n); if(0 = n) then RETURN(1); else RETURN(Xmult(n,Xfactorial(n-1))); fi; end;Xmult := proc(n,m) option remember; if(0 = n) then RETURN(0); else RETURN(XORnos(((n mod 2)*m),Xmult(floor(n/2),m*2))); fi; end;
mathematica: Xmult[nn_, mm_] := Module[{n = nn, m = mm, s = 0}, While[n > 0, If[1 == Mod[n, 2], s = BitXor[s, m]]; n = Floor[n/2]; m = m*2]; s];Xfactorial[n_] := Xfactorial[n] = If[0 == n, 1, Xmult[n, Xfactorial[n - 1]] ];Table[Xfactorial[n], {n, 0, 21}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Mar 04 2016, updated Mar 06 2016 after Maple *)
